meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a prophet or prophecy.
meanings.sent1: Her vatical dreams often foretold future events.
meanings.sent2: The vatical words of the old wise man were always heeded by the villagers.
meanings.sent3: The cat's vatical behavior of hiding before a storm made the family chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The vatical aura surrounding the ancient bookshop seemed to whisper secrets of the past.
meanings.sent5: The vatical glow of the sunset painted the sky in hues of gold and pink.

meanings.sent1: The vatical visions of the seer were known to come true.
meanings.sent2: His vatical warnings about the impending disaster were taken seriously.
meanings.sent3: The weatherman's vatical predictions made the audience smile in disbelief.
meanings.sent4: The vatical accuracy of the fortune teller amazed everyone at the fair.
meanings.sent5: The vatical voice in her head whispered of dangers ahead.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the Pope or the Vatican.
meanings.sent1: The vatical robes worn by the Pope were richly embroidered.
meanings.sent2: The vatical ceremonies at the Vatican were steeped in tradition.
meanings.sent3: The tourists marveled at the vatical splendor of the Sistine Chapel.
meanings.sent4: The vatical influence of the Vatican extended far beyond its walls.
meanings.sent5: The vatical authority of the Pope was respected by millions around the world.
